 [‹ (x) Bristol Uni "physics" website banner - ITC Eras {Matthew B}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629145954/http:/typophile.com/node/19611 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for font: Guild - abandoned ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629145954/http:/typophile.com/node/19551 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Fisheye

comments.content: I’m gonna say that looks customized, especially since nobody in this forum has leapt to the ID. What font it started out as, I’m not sure.
…or perhaps it never was a font.

I have seen fonts like this. They usually have an evil-sounding name. I’ll look into and edit this post if I find anything like it.

I cleaned it up a bit to see if What the Font could do anything, but no.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629145954im_/http:/typophile.com/files/zulera_5221.jpg)

[Aenaes](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629145954/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tiro/aeneas/) has some alt characters that would allow something classier:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629145954im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rah_3885.jpg)
i personally think it looks like a slightly stretched, fattied and customized [Trajan](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629145954/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/trajan/), but maybe that’s just me.

<cite>i personally think it looks like a slightly stretched, fattied and customized Trajan, but maybe that’s just me.</cite>

I imagine that is how a lot of freeware fonts get their start (stretched, fattied/skinnied and customized)  
: )
